The David Frost Show

David: “Alright we’re just coming back, Welcome back, Welcome back with John and Yoko, Yoko and John, This song is written by, The John Sinclair song, who wrote this song?”

John: “John Sinclair, I wrote this one, he spent two years in prison virtually in isolation, in solitary, incase he infiltrated the other prisoners or something. He didn’t want any help for two years because he thought “Why bother? Justice will let me out. My appeals will let me out, gradually and gradually”. After two years he began to worry and he asked for some help. We went down, had a rally with fifteen thousand people, we weren’t the only, only people there, little Stevie Wonder, and Phil Ochs and Allen Ginsberg. It was a really big rally.”

David: “Big, big, big Stevie Wonder now.”

John: “Big Stevie Wonder, yeah. And it was a beautiful show, many people denoted their time to it, and we came along, sang the songs we sang to you and this one, John Sinclair, this was the final one. By a stroke of good luck, he was released on Monday.”
